sentences.english: She has a little retreat in the mountains.
sentences.chinese: 她在山中有一處小小的避難所。

sentences.english: They act as small laminated springs and keep the belt strap flat.
sentences.chinese: 它們可以充當小小的疊片彈簧，讓安全帶保持平整度。

sentences.english: De Roquefort allowed the fool a victory.
sentences.chinese: 雷孟達允許這個白癡一點小小的勝利。

sentences.english: This is just a small glimpse into some of his accolades as an artist.
sentences.chinese: 這些只是他作爲一名藝人，所獲成就的小小一瞥。

sentences.english: A small illustration of this is the experience of Richard Garriott.
sentences.chinese: 這副小小的插圖描繪的正是理查德加雷特的親身經歷。
小小說，“給這女孩子發獎。

sentences.english: Children at that age are only copies of their mother.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們，在那種小小年紀總是母親的再版。

sentences.english: Little Scientist of Tomorrow competitiors take part in the final exhibition in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 明日小小科學家顯示中國科技的希望。

sentences.english: A small dining room can be separated from the living room with a simple design.
sentences.chinese: 經過簡單的設計就能在客廳裏隔出一個小小的餐室。

sentences.english: Tiny games came out of nowhere to steal our hearts.
sentences.chinese: 小小的遊戲從無處可偷我們的心。

sentences.english: Let me make a modest proposal of what our life together might be like.
sentences.chinese: 讓我來小小的暢想一下你跟了我之後的生活。

sentences.english: Please accept this little gift as my esteem for you.
sentences.chinese: 奉上這小小的禮物，以表達我對您的崇高敬意。

sentences.english: the day, with the noise of this little earth, drowns the silence of all worlds.
sentences.chinese: 白天以這小小的地球的喧擾，淹沒了整個宇宙的安靜。

sentences.english: The little country schoolhouse was heated by an old-fashioned , pot - bellied stove.
sentences.chinese: 那所小小的鄉村小學依靠一箇舊式的圓肚火爐取暖。

sentences.english: Everyone in the small observation post was failing to hold back tears.
sentences.chinese: 在這個小小觀察站的所有人都忍不住掉下眼淚。

sentences.english: Turn up your head, look at the spider on the small corner of the ceiling in your house.
sentences.chinese: 擡起頭，看看那隻在你家天花板上小小角落的蜘蛛。

definition: Diandian (Chinese microblogging and social networking website)
oh (interjection indicating that one has just learned sth)
sentence-final particle that conveys informality, warmth, friendliness or intimacy/may also indicate that one is stating a fact that the other person is not aware of
(Tw) (Internet slang) Greetings! (used when it's unknown what time the reader will see one's post, or just to be cute)
(slang) novice/greenhorn/fool/idiot/abbr. for 小白臉|小白脸[xiao3 bai2 lian3], pretty boy
a modal particle indicating (don't mind it, ok)
a modal particle indicating (that's all, only, nothing much)
erhua variant of 一點|一点[yi1 dian3]
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
